conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: walls have clear height and thickness, multiple faces are visible, rooms read as volumes, and the camera is an elevated angled/isometric-like view with the roof/ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable wall thickness, clear floor plane separation, and clean cutaway; minor simplification at some wall junctions/openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout aligns well (garage at right, central hall, master suite upper area, bedrooms clustered right, open living/kitchen left). Some exterior/covered patio regions and finer partition details appear simplified or not fully represented, and several door/window positions cannot be confirmed as perfectly matching the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Beds, sofas, TV/furniture blocks, kitchen counters/island, and key bathroom fixtures are present; some rooms (e.g., dining/nook) appear under-furnished or simplified.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean, readable geometry and lighting with minimal artifacts; openings are visible though not fully detailed; presentation is uncluttered with no UI/text overlays.

detected_errors.description: Exterior/covered patio areas and some peripheral boundary geometry appear simplified or not fully carried over from the 2D plan.
Door/window placements and sizes are not consistently verifiable against the 2D plan; several openings appear generalized.
Dining/nook/study furnishing is simplified and may not reflect intended room use as clearly as the 2D plan suggests.
Some architectural details (trim, exact wall-step offsets, and small recesses) are smoothed/abstracted, reducing geometric fidelity.

summary: This is a valid cutaway 3D conversion with strong overall layout fidelity, but with noticeable simplification of exterior/patio elements and some door/window/detail mismatches versus the 2D plan.
